question.body: What movement of what molecules are primarily responsible for electricity in the heart?

response.feedback: Correct. The movement of sodium and potassium across cell membranes generate an action potential.
Incorrect. Ion channels, which are proteins, control movements of ions. They, themselves don’t move.
Incorrect. Water moves throughout the cytosol but is not responsible for electrical conduction, ions are.
Incorrect. DNA has a charge, but since it is localized within the nucleus, it does not impact charge.

part.hint: Although numerous macromolecules are involved in generating electricity in the heart, only one type of molecules moves.

question.body: What cells are responsible for electrical stimulation in the heart?

response.feedback: Correct. The pacemaker cells are specialized cardiac muscle cells.
Incorrect. These are responsible for electrical conduction in smoothe muscle cells.
Incorrect. Pacemaker cells are specialized cadiomyocytes, but are usually referred to by a special descriptor.
Incorrect. These cells line blood vessels and the inside of the heart, but they do not have electrical function.

part.hint: Although different cells within the heart conduct electricity, specialized cells initiate the electrical stimulation.
When these cells fail, an artificial device with the same name is implanted.

question.body: In what region of the heart is the electrical stimulation started?

response.feedback: Correct. The pacemaker cells are located in the sinoatrial node.
Incorrect. The AV node coordinates the electrical conductivity, but electricity is not stimulated there.
Incorrect. These fibers transmit electricity through the ventricles, but electricity is not stimulated there.
Incorrect. The Bundle of His anatomically connects the AV node with thee purkinje fibers, but electricity is not stimulated there.

part.hint: Consider the region of the heart where the electricity originates not the conduction system.
The electrical signal starts in the atrial region of the heart. “atria” is in the name.
